thread.title: Martial hits out at talks of Man United exit
thread.title_full: Martial hits out at talks of Man United exit

title: Martial hits out at talks of Man United exit
text:
Manchester United transfer news: Anthony Martial responds to continued talk of an exit February 7, 2017 8:51am by Sky Sports Source: FOX SPORTS MANCHESTER United forward Anthony Martial has rubbished stories suggesting he is looking to quit the club in the summer. 
The Mirror claimed over the weekend that the 21-year-old Frenchman was being forced out of Old Trafford by manager Jose Mourinho and was lining up a move to Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the season. 
But the out-of-favour forward hit back on social media, tweeting: â€œDont listen (to) the papers itâ€™s wrong thanks. Come on United.â€ 
Martial joined United from Monaco in September 2015 in a deal potentially worth of up to Â£58m. Dont listen the papers it's wrong thanks Come on United ğŸ”´ â€” Anthony Martial (@AnthonyMartial) February 6, 2017 
He was Unitedâ€™s top scorer last season with 17 goals in all competitions, but has struggled to cement his place in the first team under Mourinho this season and has not featured in the last three Premier League games. 
Mourinho hit out at Martial and his entourage in December after the playerâ€™s agent, Philippe Lamboley, said the former Lyon youngster was a target for Sevilla. 
â€œAnthony has to listen to me and not his agent,â€ Mourinho said. â€œWith Martial, every day I read the newspaper. â€˜Martial goes to Sevillaâ€™, â€˜Martial goes on loanâ€™, â€˜Martial is not happyâ€™. Martial has to listen to me. He is a player with amazing conditions to be a top player.â€ 
In December, Martial was quoted as telling French broadcaster SFR Sport: â€œItâ€™s annoying to be on the bench, itâ€™s truly annoying, but itâ€™s a test you have to overcome and thatâ€™s how you progress. 
â€œItâ€™s difficult because all you want is to be able to help the team and when youâ€™re on the bench you canâ€™t.â€ Mata's clinical challenge
